Orchestra - Bulgarian Symphony Orchestra

Antonello Venditti mostly if not always wrote and writes his own lyrics.

Antonello Venditti, in the mid seventies to the mid eighties enjoyed his most biggest success mainly in Italy, and was part of the cantautori ( songwriters ) scene of that time.
With the likes of Lucio Battisti, Francesco Guccini, Francesco De Gregori, Fabrizio de Andre, Roberto Vecchioni, Claudio Baglioni, Lucio Dalla, Venditti was topping the music charts and the italian hit parade almost monthly.
As most italian songwriters in that period, Venditti wrote his own lyrics and music, played the piano and sang his own songs.
The Antonello Venditti songs are mostly melodic, harmonious, a few even dance hits in the late seventies - Sotto il Segno dei Pesci, some political manifestos, but also nostalgic views on life, memories and day to day life in Italy.

Buona Domenica portrays with almost perfection how Italians did then and still do today spend their Sundays, Compagno di Scuola about childhood school day memories, Sarah, a young girl awaiting a child, In Questo Mondo di Ladri about thieving italian politicians, and many many more about friendship, Rome his home town and football team
